intro: Leontoglossum scabrum, commonly known as the rough leontoglossum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves that are often covered in a rough, scaly texture. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Leontoglossum scabrum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
